bibl.title: Empedocles at Panopolis and Delphi.
bibl.note: 1. The new text [P. Stras. Inv. 1665-1666 (= M.-P.3 356.11; LDAB 824)]. - 2. The polyphony of Empedocles' poem (or poems). - 3. Distant echoes: Lucretius' Empedocles. - 4. Echoes of Empedocles in Athens. - 5. Empedocles at Delphi and Panopolis.

bibl.title: "Presocratics and Plato: Festschrift at Delphi in Honor of Charles Kahn. Papers Presented at the Festschrift Symposium in Honor of Charles Kahn Organized by the HYELE Institute for Comparative Studies, European Cultural Center of Delphi, June 3rd-7th, 2009, Delphi, Greece."

bibl.seg: Diskin Clay, Empedocles at Panopolis and Delphi.

Richard Patterson, Vassilis Karasmanis & Arnold Hermann (edd.), Presocratics and Plato: Festschrift at Delphi in Honor of Charles Kahn. Papers Presented at the Festschrift Symposium in Honor of Charles Kahn Organized by the HYELE Institute for Comparative Studies, European Cultural Center of Delphi, June 3rd-7th, 2009, Delphi, Greece (Las Vegas - Zurich - Athens, 2012) pp. 59-77.

1. The new text [P. Stras. Inv. 1665-1666 (= M.-P.3 356.11; LDAB 824)]. - 2. The polyphony of Empedocles' poem (or poems). - 3. Distant echoes: Lucretius' Empedocles. - 4. Echoes of Empedocles in Athens. - 5. Empedocles at Delphi and Panopolis.
